instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Bugs in the image!?
threads.message:
Hello,
There is a disturbance in the screen image. 
A Brief History: Small Water Damage. The motherboard did not start. Corrosion near <CHIP>U2500</CHIP>, <CHIP>U3210</CHIP>. light heat in <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> and <CHIP>U2800</CHIP>. I replaced the <CAPACITOR>C2411</CAPACITOR> and the board started. I also replaced <CAPACITOR>C3280</CAPACITOR>.
then these strange pixel bars are present. Their presence changes when the system is used. Small irritants even sometimes disappear.
F??k them, what's their problem?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Bugs in the image!?
threads.message: Does it happen externally? If yes, CPU is damaged. If no, then bad LCD.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Bugs in the image!?
threads.message: Hello JohnB, thank you for your reply. Bad news. The defect is present on an external monitor. CPU, the whole area looks clean. Does it make sense, to wash it in the ultrasonic tub?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Bugs in the image!?
threads.message:
If the problem exists on external monitor too, then should be RAM, or CPU issue.
Check resistors and capacitors for <CHIP>U2500</CHIP> RAM chip and others near the affected area.
You can try to heat RAM chips, using good flux; NO "chinese honey" allowed!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Bugs in the image!?
threads.message: I'm with 2informaticos inspect for anything knocked off by the RAM and reflow the 4 RAM chips. If no change, this is junk.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Bugs in the image!?
threads.message: Hello 2informaticos, thanks for the reply. A New Hope in Bord Wars!
